activities.name: Mole Movie Week
activities.description: A week of special film screenings, events, and exhibitions at the National Cinema Museum inside the iconic Mole Antonelliana, celebrating Italian and international cinema.
activities.seasonal_notes: Typically held in late April or May. Schedule announced on the museum's official website.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online in advance for popular screenings or events.

activities.name: Cherry Blossom Viewing in Parco del Valentino
activities.description: Enjoy the beautiful cherry blossoms and spring flowers throughout Turin's largest park along the Po River.
activities.seasonal_notes: Blossoms usually peak in April, depending on weather. The park becomes increasingly lively as temperatures rise.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed. Consider renting a bicycle to explore more of the park.

activities.name: Superga Bike Climb
activities.description: Challenge yourself with the scenic bike climb up to the Basilica of Superga, famous in cycling lore. Enjoy panoramic views of Turin and the Alps from the top.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers comfortable temperatures for the climb and clearer views of the Alps.
activities.booking_tips: Bike rentals available in the city center. Visitor information and basilica opening hours available online.

activities.name: Salone Internazionale del Libro (Turin International Book Fair)
activities.description: Italy's largest book fair featuring publishers, authors, and literary events. A major cultural event with readings, discussions, and book presentations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held annually in May at the Lingotto exhibition center. Very popular with both industry professionals and the public.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Check the program for specific author events you might want to attend.

activities.name: Aperitivo al Fresco
activities.description: Experience Turin's aperitivo tradition at outdoor terraces and piazzas as the weather warms up, enjoying pre-dinner drinks and snacks in social settings.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring evenings are ideal for outdoor aperitivo. Many venues set up expanded outdoor seating.
activities.booking_tips: Reservations recommended for popular spots, especially on weekends. Try Piazza Vittorio Veneto or San Salvario district.

activities.name: Kappa FuturFestival
activities.description: One of Europe's premier electronic music festivals, held in Parco Dora, featuring world-famous DJs and artists across multiple stages in a post-industrial setting.
activities.seasonal_notes: Typically held in early July. Can be very hot during the day, with cooler evenings.
activities.booking_tips: Buy tickets well in advance as they often sell out. Consider multi-day passes. Prepare for the heat with water and sun protection.

activities.name: Turin Summer Music Festivals (e.g., TODAYS)
activities.description: Various music festivals and concert series held in outdoor venues throughout the city featuring rock, indie, jazz, and classical performances.
activities.seasonal_notes: Multiple festivals throughout summer, with TODAYS typically in August. Check current schedules on the city's official tourism website.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance. Venues range from Parco della Pellerina to Spazio 211.

activities.name: Cinema a Palazzo Reale
activities.description: Open-air film screenings in the magnificent gardens of the Royal Palace, featuring classic and contemporary Italian and international films.
activities.seasonal_notes: Typically runs through July and August on select evenings. Magical setting under the stars.
activities.booking_tips: Check program and purchase tickets online. Bring something to sit on if not provided.

activities.name: River Po Rowing & Canoeing
activities.description: Explore Turin from the water by renting a canoe, kayak, or rowing boat on the Po River, offering unique views of the city's landmarks.
activities.seasonal_notes: The river is typically calmest in the early morning or evening. Avoid the midday heat.
activities.booking_tips: Rentals available at various points along the river, including near Parco del Valentino. Some basic instruction may be provided.

activities.name: Alps Day Trips
activities.description: Escape the summer heat with day trips to nearby Alpine valleys, enjoying hiking, mountain villages, and cooler temperatures.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer is ideal for Alpine exploration with clear trails and accessible mountain passes.
activities.booking_tips: Consider destinations like Val di Susa, Bardonecchia, or Sestriere. Public transport options available, but a car offers more flexibility.

activities.name: Evening Passeggiata & Gelato
activities.description: Join locals for the traditional evening stroll through Turin's elegant center, stopping for artisanal gelato at one of the city's renowned gelaterie.
activities.seasonal_notes: A quintessential Italian summer evening ritual. Most lively on weekends.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed. Try Via Po, Via Roma, or Piazza Castello for strolling. Notable gelaterias include Fiorio, Pepino, and Grom.

activities.name: Salone del Gusto / Terra Madre
activities.description: Slow Food's international biennial festival celebrating food culture, sustainability, and biodiversity, featuring tastings, workshops, and food producers from around the world.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in even-numbered years, typically in September or October. One of the world's premier food events.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets and book specific workshops online in advance, as popular events sell out quickly.

activities.name: Alba White Truffle Fair Day Trip
activities.description: Take a day trip to Alba (about 1.5 hours from Turin) for the famous International White Truffle Fair, featuring the prized Piedmontese delicacy at its seasonal peak.
activities.seasonal_notes: Runs from early October to early December. Weekends are busiest but most atmospheric.
activities.booking_tips: Consider a guided tour with transportation from Turin. Book restaurants in Alba well in advance if planning to dine there.

activities.name: Torino Film Festival
activities.description: One of Italy's most important film festivals, featuring international premieres, retrospectives, and special events throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Usually held in late November. Attracts film enthusiasts and industry professionals.
activities.booking_tips: Check the festival website for program and ticket information. Book popular screenings in advance.

activities.name: Artissima Contemporary Art Fair
activities.description: Italy's most important contemporary art fair, showcasing galleries, artists, and special exhibitions at Lingotto Fiere.
activities.seasonal_notes: Typically held in early November. A major event in the international art calendar.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online. Plan to spend several hours exploring. Often coincides with gallery openings throughout the city.

activities.name: Hiking in the Turin Hills
activities.description: Explore the colorful autumn foliage on trails in the hills surrounding Turin (Collina Torinese), enjoying panoramic views of the city against the backdrop of the Alps.
activities.seasonal_notes: Fall colors typically peak in October. Weather is usually mild and pleasant for hiking.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed. Popular routes include paths to Basilica di Superga and around Parco Naturale della Collina di Superga.

activities.name: Christmas Markets
activities.description: Browse traditional Christmas markets set up in Piazza Castello, Piazza Solferino, and other locations around the city, featuring crafts, decorations, and seasonal food.
activities.seasonal_notes: Markets typically run from late November through Epiphany (January 6). Most festive after dark when lights are on.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Weekdays are less crowded than weekends.

activities.name: Luci d'Artista (Artist Lights)
activities.description: Experience Turin's famous light art installations that transform the city center into an open-air contemporary art gallery during the winter months.
activities.seasonal_notes: Installations are typically displayed from late October/early November through January. Most impressive after dark.
activities.booking_tips: Free walking maps available at tourist offices. Consider joining a guided tour for context about the artists and installations.

activities.name: Alpine Skiing Day Trip
activities.description: Take advantage of Turin's proximity to the Alps with a day trip to nearby ski resorts like Sestriere, Bardonecchia, or Sauze d'Oulx, all within 1-2 hours of the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Ski season typically runs December through March, with best conditions usually in January-February.
activities.booking_tips: Consider the ski bus services from Turin. Book equipment rental and ski passes in advance, especially during peak periods.

activities.name: Hot Chocolate & Bicerin Tour
activities.description: Warm up with Turin's famous hot chocolate and traditional Bicerin (layered coffee, chocolate, and cream) at historic cafes like Caffè Al Bicerin, Baratti & Milano, and Caffè Torino.
activities.seasonal_notes: A perfect winter activity when it's cold outside. Historic cafes are particularly atmospheric during the holiday season.
activities.booking_tips: No reservations needed, though Caffè Al Bicerin can have queues. Prices are higher sitting at a table versus standing at the bar.

activities.name: Museo Egizio on Snowy Days
activities.description: Take advantage of colder days to explore the Egyptian Museum (second largest in the world after Cairo) without the summer crowds.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is low season for tourism, offering a more relaxed museum experience. Special exhibitions often run during this period.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online to skip the line. Consider the Torino+Piemonte Card for museum discounts.

activities.name: Carnevale Celebrations
activities.description: Experience local carnival festivities, including the historical Carnevale di Ivrea (about 1 hour from Turin), famous for its spectacular Battle of the Oranges.
activities.seasonal_notes: Celebrations occur in the period before Lent (typically February). Dates vary each year based on Easter calendar.
activities.booking_tips: For Ivrea's orange battle, book transportation and accommodations well in advance. Wear old clothes and protective gear if participating!
